item.title: Incentive Ratio in Manipulating on Probabilistic Serial Rule
item.description: Probabilistic Serial rule is a one of the most prominent randomized allocation rules. However, it is not immune to manipulating behavior of agent. In this project, we try to characterize the extent to which an individual agent can increase its utility by strategic manipulation.

item.title: Online Scheduling Algorithm Design in Edge Computing System
item.description:
In this project, we aim at working out some practical online scheduling algorithms to obtain effective task scheduling in edge computing system. Modern applications are complicate and always latency-sensitive. Edge computing is a promising computing paradigm aiming at reducing communication latency within the application and supporting applications of Internet of Things (IoT). This project is motivated by the need of scheduling strategy specific to Edge Computing and already had two papers1 published.

  1. Dependent task placement and scheduling with function configuration in edge computing and Online Dispatching and Scheduling of Jobs with Heterogeneous Utilities in Edge Computing ^
